title: Coronation Street spoilers: Pregnant Gemma rushed to hospital after incident
text:
Pregnant Gemma Winter (Dolly Rose Campbell) is set to be left fearing for her unborn quadruplets after she has to go to hospital in the wake of getting stuck in a turnstile in Coronation Street. Will everything be okay with the unborn babies or is there heartbreak ahead for her and Chesney Brown (Sam Aston)?

As a chuffed Gemma tells Chesney that she has managed to snag free VIP tickets to County’s match, they head out to the game but she is mortified when she ends up stuck in the turnstile due to her pregnant stomach.

As she struggles, she and Chesney worry about the pressure on her and firemen have to be called to dismantle the turnstile and free Gemma. As Gemma is embarrassed by the whole situation, Chesney insists on taking her to hospital.

She heads home and she is further humiliated when she finds out an image of her being stuck in the turnstile is the front page of the Weatherfield Gazette. However, when a PR Agent insists that she could make a small fortune if she does interviews about both the incident and the quads, her interest is piqued.

It all pales into insignificance though when she starts having stomach pains. At the hospital, Gemma is warned that she needs to get lots of rest and it is a wake up call for her and Chesney.

Advertisement

Advertisement

However, Bernie (Jane Hazlegrove) is still keen on Gemma pursuing the money making and offers to take over PR – which can only end in disaster! While Gemma accepts this, Chesney is worried that this will only lead to more stress for Gemma.

In upcoming scenes, things will get even more intense as Gemma ends up going into labour while she and Chesney are trapped in a cable car.

Nothing is ever simple for this pair – will all of the babies be okay?

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Will the babies be okay in Corrie?
